And such a person is the seller of the worldly life (Dunya) for the Hereafter (Akhirah), and the state (Hal) of the martyr (Shahid) corresponds to the meaning of your saying 'There is no god but Allah' (La ilaha illa Allah), for he has no objective (Maqsud) except Allah the Exalted, and every objective is worshipped (Ma'bud), and every worshipped one is a god (Ilah). So this martyr is saying with the tongue (Lisan) of his state (Hal) 'There is no god but Allah', since he has no objective other than Him. And whoever says that with his tongue but his state (Hal) does not assist his speech (Maqal), his affair is in the will (Mashiyyah) of Allah the Exalted, and safety from danger is not assured in his case. Therefore, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) preferred the saying 'There is no god but Allah' over all other remembrances (Adhkar), and he mentioned that absolutely in places of encouragement, then mentioned in some places sincerity (Sidq) and devotion (Ikhlas), saying once: 'Whoever says 'There is no god but Allah' with devotion (Mukhlisan)', and the meaning of devotion (Ikhlas) is the assistance of the state (Hal) to the speech (Maqal). So we ask Allah the Exalted to make us at the conclusion (Khatimah) among the people of 'There is no god but Allah' in state (Hal) and speech (Maqal), outwardly (Zahiran) and inwardly (Batinan), until we bid farewell to the worldly life (Dunya) not attached to it but rather averse to it and loving the meeting (Liqa') with Allah. For whoever loves the meeting (Liqa') with Allah the Exalted, Allah loves his meeting (Liqa'), and whoever dislikes the meeting (Liqa') with Allah, Allah dislikes his meeting (Liqa'). These are indicators (Maramiz) to the meanings (Ma'ani) of the remembrance (Dhikr) that cannot be increased upon in the science (Ilm) of interaction (Mu'amalah). And He said: 'And your Lord says, "Call upon Me; I will respond to you." Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell in humiliation.' And He the Exalted said: 'Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names."' And Nu'man ibn Bashir reported from the Prophet (peace be upon him) that he said: 'Supplication (Dua) is worship (Ibadah), then he recited: "Call upon Me; I will respond to you."' And he (peace be upon him) said: 'Supplication (Dua) is the marrow (Mukhkh) of worship (Ibadah).' And Abu Hurairah reported that he (peace be upon him) said: 'There is nothing more honorable to Allah the Exalted than supplication (Dua).' And he (peace be upon him) said: 'The servant (Abd) does not cease to be in good as long as he supplicates (Yad'u) his Lord.' Then he said: 'So know that there is no god but Allah and seek forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows your movements and your resting places.'

Know that poverty (al-faqr) is an expression for the loss of what one is in need of, whereas the loss of what one has no need for is not called poverty. If what is needed exists and is attainable, the one in need is not poor. If you understand this, you will not doubt that every existent besides Allah the Exalted is poor because it is in need of the continuation of existence in the next moment, and the continuation of existence is obtained from the grace of Allah the Exalted for its existence. If there exists in existence an existent whose existence is not obtained from another, then He is the Absolutely Rich (al-Ghani al-Mutlaq), and it is inconceivable that such an existent could be except one. Thus, there is in existence only one Rich (Ghani), and everyone besides Him is in need of Him to extend their existence with continuation. To this exclusivity is the allusion in His saying, the Exalted: "And Allah is the Rich (al-Ghani) and you are the poor (al-fuqara')." This is the meaning of poverty absolutely. However, we do not intend to explain absolute poverty but poverty from wealth in particular, otherwise the poverty of the servant (al-'abd) in relation to the varieties of his needs is not limited, because his needs are without limit.
